repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Education and Health
            Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome was generally
            satisfactory: Considering the degree of economic, political,
            and social turmoil during project implementation, the
            project's achievements have been remarkable, with all
            project activities fully implemented. The sustainability of
            the project is highly likely. For both the World Bank and
            the Borrower, overall performance was satisfactory. Lessons
            learned included the following: The key to a successful
            project in a post-conflict context, with a newly formed and
            inexperienced government body, is to establish a
            well-designed and simple framework for project management.
            Here, simple but comprehensive responsibility matrices
            facilitated successful implementation. The Staff Appraisal
            Report clearly spelled out staffing and functions of the
            PCUs in great detail. Second, the Borrower should ensure
            that donors' contributions are properly coordinated
            with overall program objectives. The education and health
            ministries will need to develop their institutional
            capacities to ensure this coordination. Third, timely use of
            technical assistance is critical for project success; there
            has been lack of clarity about TA needs and implementing
            agencies have lacked absorptive capacity. Fourth,
            operational support to implementing units is critical to
            establishing technical and managerial capacity. Also
            integration of the implementing unit into the structure of
            the ministry, and continuity of implementation staff, are
            needed for sustained supoport when a project closes.

repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Education and Health
            Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Education and Health Rehabilitation
            Project will concentrate on upgrading the neglected physical
            infrastructure in both sectors, and addressing quality of
            service and institutional development issues in health.
            Institutional development and some quality aspects in the
            education sector will be funded by donors. The Project will
            consist of the following two components: (i) the education
            sector; and (ii) the health sector.
